Posts.Content: Hello, I found this article I hope it helps. It talks about a therapy that has been used for this type of cancer. IBCC: Breast-Preserving Therapy Effective for Metaplastic Breast Carcinoma By Alison Palkhivala BANFF, AB -- August 6, 2003 -- Metaplastic carcinoma of the breast can be treated effectively with breast-preserving therapy, according to a 15-year retrospective analysis presented at the Second Annual Future of Breast Cancer : An International Breast Cancer Congress, held here July 31st to August 3rd. Kenneth Lodin, MD, and colleagues from Kaiser Permanente Medical Center, Los Angeles, California, United States, treated 19 patients with metaplastic carcinoma of the breast with breast-preserving therapy between 1987 and 2002. Patients ranged in age from 26 to 76 years, with a mean age of 52. Mean tumor size was 3.0 cm, and each patient received a radiation dose that ranged between 5000 and 6000 cGy, with a mean dose of 5215 cGy. Eighteen patients underwent pathological examination of their lymph nodes; 17% of these patients had positive nodes; 22% were estrogen-receptor positive; and all patients received tamoxifen. Eleven patients received adjuvant chemotherapy, and adriamycin was used in 10 of these patients. I am a librarian and will keep looking for more information for you.
Posts.Title: Metoplastic Carsonoma cancer, i really need help!!!
